trans-unit.source: Specifies the Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML) action to be taken in rendering a given `TextFragment`.
<xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> represents requests for servicing a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.

The actions correspond closely to elements in the SSML specification and are implemented on the text returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.TextToSpeak%2A> property on a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>.

The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> value associated with a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> is returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.State%2A> property.

Processing of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> value returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.State%2A> property is handled by a speech synthesizes implementation of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineSsml.Speak%2A> method on a class derived from <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineSsml>.
Indicates that <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> is to be used as the contents of a bookmark.
Corresponds to the `<mark>` XML tag in the SSML specification.
Indicates that no action has been determined from SSML input.
The associated <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> is an unknown XML tag not part of the SSML standard.
This input that may be interpreted or ignored by at the discretion of a synthesis engine.
Requests that input <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> text be interpreted as phonemes.

Exact pronunciation is specified by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Phoneme%2A> member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> object returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.State%2A> property on <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> instances.
Corresponds to the `<Phoneme>` XML tag in the SSML specification.
Indicates that a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> contains no text to be rendered as speech.

Duration of the silence is specified by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState.Duration%2A> member of the he <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.FragmentState> object returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.State%2A> property on <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> instances.
Corresponds to the `<Silence>` XML tag in the SSML specification.
Requests that the associated <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> should be processed and spoken.
This is the default value of <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TtsEngineAction> for a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment>,
Corresponds to the `<speak>` XML tag in the SSML specification

Indicates that text values provided by a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> through its <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment.TextToSpeak"></xref> property are to be synthesize as individual characters.
This rendering includes punctuation, other than white space, as well as alphanumeric text.
For example thee associated text fragment "word!"
should be synthsized into "w o r d exclamation point".
Indicates state of paragraph.

Corresponds to the `

` XML tag in the SSML specification
Indicates start of sentence.
Corresponds to the `<s>` XML tag in the SSML specification
